Stage Results A RallyDataJunkie Adventure Preface Who This Review Is For

Stage Results A RallyDataJunkie Adventure Tony Hirst Last generated on 25 February, 2022 Preface Automatically generated stage timing and results for stages on Rally Sweden, 2022. Based on analysis of timing and results data downloaded from the WRC website. To discuss / critique / comment on these analyses, please use the discussion forum. For a guide to the code used to generate the stage reports, see Visualising WRC Rally Results. See also Visualising WRC Rally Stages. This report is unofficial and is not associated in any way with the Fédération Internationale de l’Automobile (FIA) or WRC Promoter GmbH. Who This Review Is For The RallyDataJunkie project, such as it is, is a personal exploration of various ways of representing and visualising rally related stage, timing and results data. There are several potential audiences: rally fans, looking for summaries of rally events; teams and crews, looking for variously arranged summaries to check and compare performances; commentators and journalists, looking for variously arranged summaries and overviews as a tool for confirming or identifying storypoints; data folk, looking for various ways of representing various route, timing or results data.

The advantage of this ordering is that it helps register “surprise” arising from a perhaps unexpected stage winner. The chart gives the summary of stage rank evolution. Note that the stage position is based on the positions given by WRC Live Timing. If two drivers record the same time (or at least, same time to a tenth of a second), only one of them will have position==1 and the other will be position==2. the stage winner. 1.1.6 Ultimate Stage Comparisons Split time comparisons relative to various ultimate stage time calculations. These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 1.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times the stage winner. 2.1.6 Ultimate Stage Comparisons Split time comparisons relative to various ultimate stage time calculations. These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 2.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times places to gain the overall lead of the rally making a time of 759.6s. ROV was in second position on stage, 2.5s behind LAP . SOL took third on stage, 3.8s behind LAP in a time of 763.4s . TÄN was in fourth position on stage, 5.7s behind the stage winner in a time of 765.3s and dropped three places to lose the overall lead, falling back to fourth overall. EVA was in fifth place on stage, with a time of 765.5s and moved up one place to fifth overall, just 0.2s off TÄN. NEU took sixth position on stage, with a time of 768.4s dropped two places to sixth overall. KAT took seventh place on stage, with a time of 777.5s and moved up one place to seventh overall. GRE took eighth position on stage, 22.8s behind the stage winner in a time of 782.4s and moved up one place to eighth overall. FOU was in ninth place on stage, 4.0s further back behind GRE and moved up one place to ninth overall. BRE was in fortieth on stage dropped three places to tenth overall, 600.0s behind LAP in a time of 1359.6s, significantly further behind FOU, who was 413.4s faster. 2.3 Driver Report, SS2 - ROV ROV was in second position on stage, 2.5s behind LAP . ultimate stage time calculations. These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 3.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times Stage report for SS3: ROV recorded the stage win and picked up one place to gain the overall lead recording a time of 486.7s. NEU took second position on stage, 0.7s behind ROV and moved up four places to second overall, just 0.7s off ROV. EVA took third on stage, 4.5s behind the stage winner in a time of 491.2s and moved up one place to fourth overall. SOL was in fourth position on stage, 4.0s further back behind EVA . KAT took fifth on stage, 9.0s behind the stage winner in a time of 495.7s , only 0.5s behind SOL. TÄN was in sixth position on stage, 11.0s behind stage winner ROV in a time of 497.7s dropped one place to fifth overall. GRE was in seventh place on stage, 14.1s behind ROV in a time of 500.8s . LAP took eighth on stage, 15.0s behind stage winner ROV and dropped five places to lose the overall lead, falling back to sixth overall and just 0.9s further back behind GRE. FOU took ninth on stage, 18.0s behind ROV in a time of 504.7s . BRE was in fortieth on stage, with a time of 1086.7s, well back on FOU, who was 406.6s faster. 3.3 Driver Report, SS3 - ROV ROV recorded the stage win and picked up one place to gain the overall lead recording a time of 486.7s. ultimate stage time calculations. These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 4.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times stage time calculations. These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 5.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times LAP took second on stage, 1.8s behind stage winner TÄN . EVA was in third place on stage, with a time of 755.1s kept hold of the overall lead of the rally. NEU was in fourth on stage, with a time of 755.8s and moved up one place to fifth overall, just 0.7s off EVA. ROV was in fifth position on stage, 3.1s behind NEU dropped two places to sixth overall. SOL was in sixth place on stage, with a time of 759.5s dropped two places to fourth overall, just 0.6s further back behind ROV. FOU took seventh position on stage, with a time of 762.9s and moved up one place to eighth overall. KAT took eighth on stage, with a time of 764.3s and moved up one place to seventh overall. GRE took tenth position on stage, 40.5s behind TÄN dropped two places to ninth overall, just 0.1s off KAT. BRE was in thirty-sixth on stage, 600.0s behind TÄN in a time of 1351.0s, well back on GRE, who was 294.1s faster. 5.3 Driver Report, SS5 - ROV ROV was in fifth position on stage, 3.1s behind NEU dropped two places to sixth overall. These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 6.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 7.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times TÄN Stage report for SS7: ROV took the stage and moved up two places to second overall taking a time of 216.2s. NEU took second position on stage, 1.1s behind ROV and picked up one place to gain overall lead . KAT was in third place on stage, 6.2s behind NEU . GRE took fourth on stage, 8.4s behind stage winner ROV . FOU was in fifth on stage, with a time of 225.1s, just 0.5s off GRE. LAP was in sixth place on stage, with a time of 225.2s dropped one place to fourth overall, just 0.1s further back behind FOU. EVA was in seventh place on stage, with a time of 225.3s and dropped two places to lose the overall lead, falling back to third overall, just 0.1s off LAP. SOL took tenth on stage, 3.0s further back behind EVA . TÄN took thirty-fifth on stage, 600.0s behind ROV in a time of 816.2s, significantly further behind SOL, who was 527.2s faster. BRE took thirty-sixth on stage, with a time of 816.2s matching the time of TÄN. 7.3 Driver Report, SS7 - ROV ROV took the stage and moved up two places to second overall taking a time of 216.2s.
